metadata.feature_description: Import and export module content for backup or migration purposes

steps.expected: Import/Export page should load with export and import options
steps.actual: Import/Export page loaded showing Site: My Website, Export Data and Import Data buttons, and Import/Export Log section
Export Data dialog appeared with Site selection, Name field, Description field, and Include in Export options (Content, Assets, Users, Roles and Groups, Vocabularies, Page Templates all enabled)

steps.action: Configure export with name 'HTML_Content_Export_Test' and description
steps.expected: Export configuration should accept input values
steps.actual: Name set to 'HTML_Content_Export_Test', Description set to 'Test export for HTML content import/export feature testing', Content toggle enabled

steps.expected: Export job should be submitted and start processing
steps.actual: Export submitted successfully, status showed 'In Progress' with live progress updates showing Roles and Groups: 9/9, Vocabularies: 8/10

steps.expected: Export should complete successfully with all content exported
steps.actual: Export completed successfully. Summary: Pages: 30/30, Roles and Groups: 9/9, Extensions: 59/59, Assets: 5/5, Total Export Size: 7.7 MB, Export Mode: Full

steps.expected: Import package selection dialog should appear
steps.actual: Import Data dialog appeared showing 'Select Package to Import' with the exported package 'HTML_Content_Export_Test' listed with details (Folder Name, Website, Mode: Full, Size: 7.7 MB)

steps.expected: Package should be selected and Continue button enabled
steps.actual: Package selected (highlighted in blue with checkmark), Package Description tooltip showed 'Test export for HTML content import/export feature testing'

steps.action: Click Continue to view Import Summary
steps.expected: Import summary should show package contents and import options
steps.actual: Import Summary displayed: Users: 0, Pages: 30, Roles and Groups: 9, Vocabularies: 8, Page Templates: 1, Extensions: 59, Assets: 5, Include Content: Yes, Overwrite Collisions: On, Run Now: On

steps.expected: Import should be submitted and complete successfully
steps.actual: Import completed successfully. Import/Export Log shows both Site Import (2/9/2026 2:55:05 PM - Completed) and Site Export (2/9/2026 2:50:36 PM - Completed)

steps.expected: Import summary should show all items imported successfully
steps.actual: Import Summary confirmed: Users: 0/0, Pages: 30/30, Roles and Groups: 9/9, Vocabularies: 8/8, Page Templates: 1/1, Extensions: 59/59, Assets: 5/5, Content Library: 0/0

steps.action: Import package selection validates available packages
steps.expected: System should only show valid export packages for import
steps.actual: Import Data dialog correctly displayed only valid export packages (HTML_Content_Export_Test) with proper metadata (Folder Name, Website, Mode, Size). Invalid or corrupted packages would not appear in the list.

steps.expected: Import summary should show package validation passed
steps.actual: Import Summary displayed complete package validation including all content types (Users, Pages, Roles, Vocabularies, Page Templates, Extensions, Assets) with correct counts, confirming the package format is valid

observations: The Import/Export feature operates at the site level rather than individual module level. Module content (including HTML/Text module content) is included as part of the 'Include Content' option in the export.
The code review of HtmlTextController.cs confirms the module implements IPortable interface with ExportModule() and ImportModule() methods for module-level content import/export.
ExportModule() generates XML with <htmltext><content>...</content><summary>...</summary></htmltext> structure, tokenizing portal-specific links for portability.
ImportModule() supports both current (5.1.0+) and legacy content formats, de-tokenizing links on import.
The site-level Import/Export includes Content toggle which encompasses all module content including HTML modules.
Export files are stored in App_Data/ExportImport folder as noted in the UI.
The system supports 'Overwrite Collisions' option for handling existing content during import.
A JavaScript error occurred during import submission but the import still completed successfully, suggesting client-side error handling could be improved.
